thread.title: Mets' Daniel Murphy homers in MLB-record sixth straight postseason game
thread.title_full: Mets' Daniel Murphy homers in MLB-record sixth straight postseason game

author: azcentral.com
title: Mets' Daniel Murphy homers in MLB-record sixth straight postseason game
text:
Daniel Murphy now stands alone in postseason home run lore.
The New York Mets second baseman homered for the sixth consecutive game - breaking a record he shared with Carlos Beltran - in the eighth inning of the New York Mets' Game 4 National League Championship Series romp against the Chicago Cubs at Wrigley Field.
FOR THE WIN
Mets hit back-to-back homers in first inning to grab early lead in Game 4
Murphy homered to straightaway center field off Cubs reliever Fernando Rodney, perhaps the least-decorated pitcher Murphy has touched up this postseason. Prior home run victims include the presumed top three finishes in NL Cy Young voting - Dodgers starters Clayton Kershaw and Zack Greinke and Cubs starter Jake Arrieta.
USA TODAY
Nightengale: Ruthless Mets show no mercy, flatten Cubs on way to World Series
